FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd anti-attack log-trap-timer command configures an interval for recording ND logs and sending ND traps in the case of potential attacks.
The undo ipv6 nd anti-attack log-trap-timer command restores the default configuration. The ipv6 nd anti-attack log-trap-timer command configures an interval for recording ND logs and sending ND traps in the case of potential attacks. The undo ipv6 nd anti-attack log-trap-timer command restores the default configuration. The default interval for recording ND logs and sending ND traps is 600s. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interval for recording ND logs and sending ND traps.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 3600, in seconds.
